Name.BusinessNameLine1: ST ANDREW'S SCHOOL OF BOCA RATON INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROVIDE EDUCATION FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES PK THROUGH 12.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Provide education for students in PK through 12.
IRS990.Description: INSTRUCTION - APPROXIMATELY 1306 STUDENTS FOR GRADES PK-12 INSTRUCTION - SUMMER PROGRAMINSTRUCTION -INTERNATIONAL BACCALAUREATE PROGRAM FOR 11TH AND 12TH GRADERS

Activity2.Description: STUDENT ACTIVITIES - SCHOOL PUBLICATIONS, NEWSPAPER, AND YEARBOOK.

Activity3.Description: AUXILIARY SERVICES INCLUDING STUDENT CAFETERIA, INFIRMARY AND BOOKSTORE.

ActivityOther.Description: Other program services including financial aid (provided to 180 students) and tuition remission (provided to 65 students).

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The School maintains Mayan pottery and paintings to assist in the education of the topic to the student body and to preserve for the use of future students.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Saint Andrews and the Fund have been recognized by the Internal Revenue Service as organizations exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC). Accordingly, no provision for income taxes has been recorded in the consolidated financial statements. Saint Andrews and the Fund are required to operate in conformity with the provisions of the IRC to maintain their exempt status. The School adopted the provisions of FASB ASC 740-10-25 (formerly FASB Interpretation No. 48 Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes (FIN 48)). Under FIN 48, an organization must recognize the tax benefit associated with tax taken for tax return purposes when it is more likely than not the position will be sustained. The implementation of FIN 48 had no impact on the Schools financial statements. The School does not believe there are any uncertain tax positions and, accordingly, it will not recognize any liability for unrecognized tax benefits. No interest or penalties were accrued as of July 1, 2009, as a result of the adoption of FIN 48. For the year ended June 30, 2010, there were no interest or penalties recorded or included in the Schools consolidated financial statements.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: ADVERTISEMENTS ARE PLACED IN THREE NEWSPAPERS SERVING AREAS FROM WHICH STUDENTS ARE RECRUITED. COPIES OF ADVERTISEMENTS ARE ON FILE IN ACCORDANCE WITH REVENUE PROCEDURES 75-70, SECTION 7.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Financial aid is awarded based on financial need. Financial need is determined from a completed financial aid application submitted by the family requesting aid. The School's Financial Aid Committee uses a third-party service to help to objectively determine a family's ability to pay for school tuition and other educational expenses, based on a Parents' Financial Statement and any additional supporting documentation from the family as may be needed.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Certain Key Employees and Highly Compensated Employees receive a housing allowance or residence for personal use for the benefit of the school.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: International Baccalaureate Program which is an academically challenging and balanced program of education with final examinations that prepares students, normally aged 16 to 19, for the university level and life beyond. The program is normally taught over two years, in the junior and seniors years of High School.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All voting board members were provided a copy of Form 990 for review prior to filing. A copy of Form 990 is also provided to the School's Audit Committee for review prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: School has a written conflict of interest policy, which requires the Board of Trustees, officers and managers to review annually the requirements for this policy. The Board, officers and managers acknowledge annually in writing their commitment to following this policy. Determination of whether a conflict exists is made by the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees, or if appealed by the full Board of Trustees. Trustees, officers and managers found to have a conflict of interest are prohibited from deliberations or decisions on the transaction. Disclosure or acknowledgement of a conflict of interest is noted in the minutes of the Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Headmaster's compensation approved annually by Board of Trustees. Chair of the Board of Trustees makes recommendation to Board of Trustees, using comparable compensation data for similarly qualified persons in similar headmaster positions in similarly situated independent schools. This process was last completed in 2009.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990, Schedule K, Part I, Line (A), Column (a). Description of Purpose of the Bond The bonds were financed for the acquisition of land, construction and equipping of an additional lower school building and improvements on the related tract of land and to retire the Schools outstanding Variable Rate Demand Revenue Refunding Bonds Series 2003.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Page 6, Part VI, Section B, Line 14
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Saint Andrew's School of Boca Raton has established a written document retention and destruction policy for both the school and the endowment. The policy will become effective in May 2011.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Page 11, Part X, Line 19 and Line 25
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Changes to Prior Period Balance Sheet
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The prior period balance sheet has been adjusted in order to more accurately reflect the liabilities of Saint Andrews School. We have moved deferred revenue from other liabilities(Line 19) to the (line 25) which is the deferred revenue line.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Schedule K, Part IV, Line E
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Saint Andrews School, Inc. had an exemption from arbitrage expiring this fiscal year, therefore there has been no requirement to file Form 8038-T. They will be required to file in the next fiscal year.
